item.title: Interference between One- and Two-Electron Channels in Resonant Inelastic X-Ray Scattering
item.description:
Author(s): Johan Söderström, Marcus Agåker, Ji-Cai Liu, Takashi Tokushima, Anirudha Ghosh, Conny Såthe, Jian Wang, Andreas Pantelis Frey Koudouridis, Moritz Grunwald-Delitz, Thomas M. Baumann, Michael Meyer, Manuel Harder, Zhong Yin, Olle Björneholm, Joseph Nordgren, Stephan Fritzsche, Victor Kimberg, Jan-Erik Rubensson, and Faris Gel’mukhanov

Interference between scattering channels is observed in resonant inelastic x-ray scattering (RIXS) at the Ne $K$ threshold. Final states with $|2{p}^{−1}np⟩$ as the main configuration are populated via $|1{s}^{−1}{n}^{′}p⟩$ resonances, where large-amplitude one-electron (${n}^{′}=n$) channels interf…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 233001] Published Mon Dec 01, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Johan Söderström, Marcus Agåker, Ji-Cai Liu, Takashi Tokushima, Anirudha Ghosh, Conny Såthe, Jian Wang, Andreas Pantelis Frey Koudouridis, Moritz Grunwald-Delitz, Thomas M. Baumann, Michael Meyer, Manuel Harder, Zhong Yin, Olle Björneholm, Joseph Nordgren, Stephan Fritzsche, Victor Kimberg, Jan-Erik Rubensson, and Faris Gel’mukhanov

Interference between scattering channels is observed in resonant inelastic x-ray scattering (RIXS) at the Ne K threshold. Final states with |2p−1np⟩ as the main configuration are populated via |1s−1n′p⟩ resonances, where large-amplitude one-electron (n′=n) channels interfere with small-amplitude two…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 233001] Published Mon Dec 01, 2025
item.dc:title: Interference between One- and Two-Electron Channels in Resonant Inelastic X-Ray Scattering
item.dc:creator: Johan Söderström, Marcus Agåker, Ji-Cai Liu, Takashi Tokushima, Anirudha Ghosh, Conny Såthe, Jian Wang, Andreas Pantelis Frey Koudouridis, Moritz Grunwald-Delitz, Thomas M. Baumann, Michael Meyer, Manuel Harder, Zhong Yin, Olle Björneholm, Joseph Nordgren, Stephan Fritzsche, Victor Kimberg, Jan-Erik Rubensson, and Faris Gel’mukhanov

item.title: Nonreciprocal Current-Induced Zero-Resistance State in Valley-Polarized Superconductors
item.description:
Author(s): Akito Daido, Youichi Yanase, and K. T. Law

The recently observed nonreciprocal current-induced zero-resistance state (CIZRS) in twisted trilayer $\mathrm{graphene}/{\text{WSe}}_{2}$ heterostructure has posed a significant theoretical challenge. In the experiment, the system shows a zero-resistance state only when a sufficiently large current…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 236001] Published Mon Dec 01, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Akito Daido, Youichi Yanase, and K. T. Law

The recently observed nonreciprocal current-induced zero-resistance state (CIZRS) in twisted trilayer graphene/WSe2 heterostructure has posed a significant theoretical challenge. In the experiment, the system shows a zero-resistance state only when a sufficiently large current is applied in a partic…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 236001] Published Mon Dec 01, 2025
item.dc:title: Nonreciprocal Current-Induced Zero-Resistance State in Valley-Polarized Superconductors
item.dc:creator: Akito Daido, Youichi Yanase, and K. T. Law

item.title: Cavity-Vacuum-Induced Chiral Spin Liquids in Kagome Lattices: Tuning and Probing Topological Quantum Phases via Cavity Quantum Electrodynamics
item.description:
Author(s): Chenan Wei, Liu Yang, and Qing-Dong Jiang

Topological phases in frustrated quantum magnetic systems have captivated researchers for decades, with the chiral spin liquid (CSL) standing out as one of the most compelling examples. Featuring long-range entanglement, topological order, and exotic fractional excitations, the CSL has inspired exte…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 236901] Published Mon Dec 01, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Chenan Wei, Liu Yang, and Qing-Dong Jiang

Topological phases in frustrated quantum magnetic systems have captivated researchers for decades, with the chiral spin liquid (CSL) standing out as one of the most compelling examples. Featuring long-range entanglement, topological order, and exotic fractional excitations, the CSL has inspired exte…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 236901] Published Mon Dec 01, 2025

item.title: Separate Surface and Bulk Topological Anderson Localization Transitions in Disordered Axion Insulators
item.description:
Author(s): Cormac Grindall, Alexander C. Tyner, Ang-Kun Wu, Taylor L. Hughes, and J. H. Pixley

In topological phases of matter for which the bulk and boundary support distinct electronic gaps, there exists the possibility of decoupled mobility gaps in the presence of disorder. This is in analogy with the well-studied problem of realizing separate or concomitant bulk-boundary criticality in co…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 226601] Published Tue Nov 25, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Author(s): Cormac Grindall, Alexander C. Tyner, Ang-Kun Wu, Taylor L. Hughes, and J. H. Pixley

In topological phases of matter for which the bulk and boundary support distinct electronic gaps, there exists the possibility of decoupled mobility gaps in the presence of disorder. This is in analogy with the well-studied problem of realizing separate or concomitant bulk-boundary criticality in co…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 226601] Published Tue Nov 25, 2025

item.title: Nonreciprocal Inertial Spin-Wave Dynamics in Twisted Magnetic Nanostrips
item.description:
Author(s): Massimiliano d’Aquino and Riccardo Hertel

We develop a theoretical framework for inertial spin-wave dynamics in three-dimensional twisted soft-magnetic nanostrips, where curvature and torsion couple with magnetic inertia to generate terahertz (THz) magnetic oscillations. The resulting spin-wave spectra exhibit pronounced nonreciprocity due …


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 216705] Published Fri Nov 21, 2025
item.content:encoded:

The resulting spin-wave spectra exhibit pronounced nonreciprocity due …

item.title: Topological Response in Open Quantum Systems with Weak Symmetries
item.description:
Author(s): Ze-Min Huang, Sebastian Diehl, and Xiao-Qi Sun

In open quantum systems, the interaction of the system with its environment gives rise to two types of symmetry: a strong one, where the system’s symmetry charge is conserved exactly, and a weak one, where the system can exchange symmetry charge with the environment but still preserve symmetry at th…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 213002] Published Thu Nov 20, 2025

item.title: Unconventional Fractional Phases in Multiband Vortexable Systems
item.description:
Author(s): Siddhartha Sarkar, Xiaohan Wan, Ang-Kun Wu, Shi-Zeng Lin, and Kai Sun

We study topological flat bands with distinct features that deviate from conventional Landau level behavior. We show that even in the ideal quantum geometry limit, moiré flat band systems can exhibit physical phenomena fundamentally different from Landau levels without lattices. In particular, we fi…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 216501] Published Thu Nov 20, 2025
item.content:encoded:

We show that even in the ideal quantum geometry limit, moiré flat band systems can exhibit physical phenomena fundamentally different from Landau levels without lattices. In particular, we fi…

item.title: Orbital Description of Landau Levels
item.description:
Author(s): Huan Wang (王欢), Rui Shi, Zhaochen Liu, and Jing Wang (王靖)

The pursuit of a lattice analog for Landau levels has been a central theme in condensed matter physics. Although the correspondence between Chern bands and the lowest Landau level has been widely studied, a lattice realization of the first Landau level remains elusive. Here, we construct a minimal l…


[Phys. Rev. Lett. 135, 216604] Published Wed Nov 19, 2025
item.content:encoded:

Although the correspondence between Chern bands and the lowest Landau level has been widely studied, a lattice realization of the first Landau level remains elusive. Here, we construct a minimal l…
